DOCNAME: CASE OF EVRENOS ÖNEN v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant is the owner of a potable and industrial water station in GPE . By a letter dated DATE the authorities from ORG informed ORG about the fact that the applicant 's company was not complying with the requirements of the relevant regulation concerning the packaging and marketing of spring and mineral waters .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in his statements taken by ORG , the applicant maintained that he had been already told by the authorities that the way he was selling water was in breach of the relevant regulation and that he had consequently closed his business DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an advance payment order of CARDINAL NORP Liras ( GPE ) for the applicant , for failure to respect the rule concerning the packaging and marketing of spring and mineral waters , provided in decree law no . CARDINAL . The applicant did not pay the fine within DATE as required by the order .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a petition with the Karşıyaka ORG , challenging the decision of ORG . He claimed that he had already made a payment . In his submissions to the court , ORG explained that the payment made by the applicant was for a previous offence , which took place on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Karşıyaka ORG dismissed the objection and issued a penal order , by which it increased the fine to ORG , due to the applicant 's failure to comply with the advance payment order .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an objection with ORG , against the penal order of DATE , alleging , in particular , a breach of LAW ( c ) of the LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Karşıyaka ORG upheld the decision of ORG , holding that it was in accordance with the law .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant paid the fine on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE , in CARDINAL equal instalments .

CARDINAL . LAW law no . CARDINAL ( amended by law no . CARDINAL ) on the packaging and marketing of spring and mineral waters , provides that the manufacturing , packaging and selling of the spring and mineral waters are under the authorisation of ORG . The principles and procedural requirements concerning these subject matters are regulated by ORG . Article CARDINAL A ( l ) of the same law provides that a company who acts in breach of LAW law no . CARDINAL would be closed , affixed with a seal and be subject to a fine . Should the company commit the same offence again , the fine would be doubled .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the former Criminal Code provide as follows :

“ If the action does not cause any sickness or prevent the victim from attending his / her usual occupation ( ... ) the offender shall be sentenced to DATE imprisonment or to a fine of GPE CARDINAL to CARDINAL . However , the legal proceedings may be initiated only upon the victim 's complaint . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant Articles of the Code of Criminal Procedure which was in force at the time of the events , read as follows :
“ Save the exceptional circumstances described by law , the courts shall decide on objections filed against the penal orders without holding a hearing .
If the objection is upheld , the same court shall decide on the merits of the case . ”
“ The judge at ORG may , without holding a hearing , rule on the offences which are within the jurisdiction of the Magistrates ' Court and it may subsequently issue a penal order .
Only the sentencing to a fine , an imprisonment DATE , a suspension of a certain profession and a seizure ( ... ) may be adjudicated by a penal order . ( ... ) ”
“ If the judge at the Magistrates ' Court considers that the lack of a hearing may put the offender in an unfavourable situation , then it could be decided to hold a hearing . “

“ In addition to the conviction , it should be noted in the penal order , the designation of the offence , the applicable provisions of law , the relevant evidence , and the possibility of raising an objection within DATE after its notification ( ... ) . The petition which raises an objection to the penal order shall be approved by the trial judge . ( ... ) ”
“ A hearing shall be held if the objection is raised against an imprisonment sentence given by a penal order . ( ... )
The suspect can be represented by a defence counsel during the hearing . ( ... )

The objections against the penal orders ( ... ) are examined by a judge at the criminal court of first instance , in line with the procedure described under LAW , CARDINAL and CARDINAL . The objection would suspend the execution of the penal order . ”

CARDINAL . In a judgment given on DATE ORG declared LAW of LAW unconstitutional and a nullity . It held that lack of a public hearing before FAC that examines the objections against the penal orders , would be in breach of the right guaranteed under LAW , as well as LAW .
CARDINAL . Additionally , the new Criminal Code and LAW which came into force on DATE , contain no provision concerning penal orders .
